intro: Adenia singaporiana, commonly known as the Singapore adenium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its thick, succulent stems and waxy leaves. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that bloom during the dry season. It is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its fleshy stems. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
